doc:
Ellen Hall https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ellen_Hall 0 Ellen Hall (April 18, 1923 – March 24, 1999) was the older daughter of show business parents Emory Johnson and Ella Hall. She achieved fame as an American B-movie actress of the 1940s and early 1950s playing mostly supporting roles in the trendy Westerns, but also acted in several family-oriented comedies and musicals. Her attractiveness opened doors to become a member of the famed Goldwyn Girls in 1943. She retired from movies and television in 1952. Ellen_Hall ( April_18_,_1923 – March_24_,_1999 ) was the_older_daughter of show_business_parents_Emory_Johnson and Ella_Hall . She achieved fame as an_American_B-movie_actress of the_1940s and early_1950s playing_mostly_supporting roles in the_trendy_Westerns , but_also acted in several_family-oriented_comedies_and_musicals . Her_attractiveness opened doors to_become a_member of the_famed_Goldwyn_Girls in 1943 . She retired from movies_and_television in 1952 .
